title: NewsBreak: U.K. Parliament Votes for Dec. 12 Early Election
text:
NewsBreak: U.K. Parliament Votes for Dec. 12 Early Election

Brexit 3 hours ago (Oct 29, 2019 20:34)

© Reuters. Investing.com – U.K. voters are heading to the ballot boxes on Dec. 12 after lawmakers backed Prime Minister Boris Johnson’s proposal to hold a snap election. The government won by 438 to 20 votes. Labour, the main opposition party in the U.K., put forward a proposal to amend the election date to Dec. 9 from Dec. 12, but failed to win enough votes. Johnson is hoping to secure a majority in the general election to break the current Brexit impasse. Earlier this week, the EU granted the U.K. a Brexit extension until Jan. 31. was flat around 1.2864.

NewsBreak: U.K. Parliament Votes for Dec. 12 Early Election
description: NewsBreak: U.K. Parliament Votes for Dec. 12 Early Election
